intro: Sonchus serratus, commonly known as the serrated sowthistle, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate, serrated leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and rough, lobed foliage. Its yellow flowers appear in clusters and bloom from late spring to early autumn. Sonchus serratus is often found in disturbed soils, along roadsides, and in fields, and it is considered a weed in some regions.
